page.title: 14History of Pickering 1
page.content: Pickering's history starts in prehistoric times,when a warmer climate covered the hilltops.Hunters and fishers of the Middle Stone Age came as nomads and made temporary settlements at Starr Carr and Seamer.After 8000B.C. they left tiny flints in clearings on the moorlands at Stoney Rigg above Farndale. The climate changed again and the nomads let the immigrants of the New Stone Age, spread over the hills.Their work was agriculture.At Ayton East Field they left barrows 85 & 165ft. long.Using primitive hoes in small fields they grew wheat and barley and had herds of domesticated animals instead of hunting and gathering.One such settlement was Sawdon Moor.
